result.execSummary:
The defendant Shakur D Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shakur D Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shakur D Jones was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision in case #14CF4408. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applies.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence , including the sentence in 14CF004408.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 673
cf
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request to clarify relationship of the sentence in this case to the sentence in 14CF004408.
9/17/15 surety came in and did an address change:  2650 N. 50th St, Milw, WI 53210, NOTE:  Bail was ordered to be applied to costs, no refund is due.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision in Case# 14CF4408.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Defendant Shakur D Jones in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Shakur D Jones in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, count 2 is DISMISSED.  As to count1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing in Branch 22 on 08/04/2015 at 1:30pm as part of a global resolution.

Defendant Shakur D Jones in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Shakur D Jones in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense Motion to Suppress proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Police Officer Daniel Resnick.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made.  Based on all testimony and evidence presented in court, the court DENIES defense motion to suppress.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM024341  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/12/2015
MOTION TO SUPRESS PHYSICAL EVIDENCE-ILLEGAL STOP,SEARCH, AND SEIZURE.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Shakur D Jones not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a motion hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shakur D Jones in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Shakur D Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
